title: Sure, here is a curated reading list of 20 articles on complex reasoning using pre-trained language models (PLMs), focusing on knowledge-augmented methods, few-shot prompting, neuro-symbolic methods, and rationale-based methods. These articles are selected to provide a comprehensive overview of the state-of-the-art research in these areas
**"Language Models as Knowledge Bases?"** by Petroni et al
Retrieval-Augmented Language Model Pre-Training"** by Guu et al
**"K-Adapter: Infusing Knowledge into Pre-Trained Models with Adapters"** by Wang et al
**"Knowledge-Aware Fine-Tuning for Better Handling Unseen Entities in Dialogue Generation"** by Liu et al
**"KEPLER: A Unified Model for Knowledge Embedding and Pre-trained Language Representation"** by Wang et al
**"Language Models are Few-Shot Learners"** by Brown et al
**"GPT-3: Language Models are Few-Shot Learners"** by OpenAI
**"Few-Shot Text Generation with Pattern-Exploiting Training"** by Schick and Sch√ºtze
**"An Empirical Study on Few-Shot Knowledge Probing"** by Jiang et al
**"Prompt Programming for Large Language Models: Beyond the Few-Shot Paradigm"** by Reynolds and McDonell
Disentangling Reasoning from Vision and Language Understanding"** by Yi et al
**"Neural-Symbolic Machines: Learning Semantic Parsers on Freebase with Weak Supervision"** by Liang et al
Neural-Symbolic Concept Learner"** by Mao et al
**"Neural-Symbolic Integration: A Compositional Perspective"** by Garcez et al
**"Neural-Symbolic Learning and Reasoning: A Survey and Interpretation"** by Besold et al
**"Rationalizing Neural Predictions"** by Lei et al
Leveraging Language Models for Commonsense Reasoning"** by Rajani et al
**"Self-Explaining Structures Improve NLP Models"** by Strout et al
**"Generating Fact Checking Explanations"** by Atanasova et al
**"Faithful and Plausible Explanations of Medical Code Predictions"** by Sushil et al

These articles cover a range of methods and approaches to enhance the reasoning capabilities of PLMs, providing a solid foundation for understanding current advancements and future directions in the field
